text-message flex flex-col items-start gap-3 whitespace-pre-wrap break-words [.text-message+&amp;]:mt-5 overflow-x-auto"><div class="markdown prose w-full break-words dark:prose-invert dark"><p>If you have an existing React application with <code>App.jsx</code> and <code>App.css</code> that you'd like to deploy as a static HTML page on GitHub Pages, you'll need to build your React app first. The build process will generate a static HTML file along with the necessary JavaScript and CSS files.</p><p>Here's how you can build and prepare your React app for GitHub Pages:</p><ol><li><p><strong>Build Your React App</strong>:</p><ul><li>In your project directory, run the build command:<pre><div class="bg-black rounded-md"><div class="flex items-center relative text-gray-200 bg-gray-800 dark:bg-token-surface-primary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-md"><span>bash</span><button class="flex gap-1 items-center"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M12 4C10.8954 4 10 4.89543 10 6H14C14 4.89543 13.1046 4 12 4ZM8.53513 4C9.22675 2.8044 10.5194 2 12 2C13.4806 2 14.7733 2.8044 15.4649 4H17C18.6569 4 20 5.34315 20 7V19C20 20.6569 18.6569 22 17 22H7C5.34315 22 4 20.6569 4 19V7C4 5.34315 5.34315 4 7 4H8.53513ZM8 6H7C6.44772 6 6 6.44772 6 7V19C6 19.5523 6.44772 20 7 20H17C17.5523 20 18 19.5523 18 19V7C18 6.44772 17.5523 6 17 6H16C16 7.10457 15.1046 8 14 8H10C8.89543 8 8 7.10457 8 6Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></div><div class="p-4 overflow-y-auto"><code class="!whitespace-pre hljs language-bash">npm run build
</code></div></div></pre></li><li>This command creates a <code>build</code> directory with a production build of your app.</li></ul></li><li><p><strong>Prepare for GitHub Pages</strong>:</p><ul><li>If you haven't already, install the <code>gh-pages</code> package:<pre><div class="bg-black rounded-md"><div class="flex items-center relative text-gray-200 bg-gray-800 dark:bg-token-surface-primary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-md"><span>bash</span><button class="flex gap-1 items-center"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M12 4C10.8954 4 10 4.89543 10 6H14C14 4.89543 13.1046 4 12 4ZM8.53513 4C9.22675 2.8044 10.5194 2 12 2C13.4806 2 14.7733 2.8044 15.4649 4H17C18.6569 4 20 5.34315 20 7V19C20 20.6569 18.6569 22 17 22H7C5.34315 22 4 20.6569 4 19V7C4 5.34315 5.34315 4 7 4H8.53513ZM8 6H7C6.44772 6 6 6.44772 6 7V19C6 19.5523 6.44772 20 7 20H17C17.5523 20 18 19.5523 18 19V7C18 6.44772 17.5523 6 17 6H16C16 7.10457 15.1046 8 14 8H10C8.89543 8 8 7.10457 8 6Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></div><div class="p-4 overflow-y-auto"><code class="!whitespace-pre hljs language-bash">npm install gh-pages --save-dev
</code></div></div></pre></li><li>Add the following scripts to your <code>package.json</code> file:<pre><div class="bg-black rounded-md"><div class="flex items-center relative text-gray-200 bg-gray-800 dark:bg-token-surface-primary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-md"><span>json</span><button class="flex gap-1 items-center"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M12 4C10.8954 4 10 4.89543 10 6H14C14 4.89543 13.1046 4 12 4ZM8.53513 4C9.22675 2.8044 10.5194 2 12 2C13.4806 2 14.7733 2.8044 15.4649 4H17C18.6569 4 20 5.34315 20 7V19C20 20.6569 18.6569 22 17 22H7C5.34315 22 4 20.6569 4 19V7C4 5.34315 5.34315 4 7 4H8.53513ZM8 6H7C6.44772 6 6 6.44772 6 7V19C6 19.5523 6.44772 20 7 20H17C17.5523 20 18 19.5523 18 19V7C18 6.44772 17.5523 6 17 6H16C16 7.10457 15.1046 8 14 8H10C8.89543 8 8 7.10457 8 6Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></div><div class="p-4 overflow-y-auto"><code class="!whitespace-pre hljs language-json"><span class="hljs-attr">"scripts"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-punctuation">{</span>
  <span class="hljs-comment">// ... other scripts</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"predeploy"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">"npm run build"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"deploy"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">"gh-pages -d build"</span>
<span class="hljs-punctuation">}</span>
</code></div></div></pre></li><li>Add a <code>homepage</code> field to your <code>package.json</code>, replacing <code>yourusername</code> with your GitHub username and <code>your-repo-name</code> with the name of your GitHub repository:<pre><div class="bg-black rounded-md"><div class="flex items-center relative text-gray-200 bg-gray-800 dark:bg-token-surface-primary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-md"><span>json</span><button class="flex gap-1 items-center"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M12 4C10.8954 4 10 4.89543 10 6H14C14 4.89543 13.1046 4 12 4ZM8.53513 4C9.22675 2.8044 10.5194 2 12 2C13.4806 2 14.7733 2.8044 15.4649 4H17C18.6569 4 20 5.34315 20 7V19C20 20.6569 18.6569 22 17 22H7C5.34315 22 4 20.6569 4 19V7C4 5.34315 5.34315 4 7 4H8.53513ZM8 6H7C6.44772 6 6 6.44772 6 7V19C6 19.5523 6.44772 20 7 20H17C17.5523 20 18 19.5523 18 19V7C18 6.44772 17.5523 6 17 6H16C16 7.10457 15.1046 8 14 8H10C8.89543 8 8 7.10457 8 6Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></div><div class="p-4 overflow-y-auto"><code class="!whitespace-pre hljs language-json"><span class="hljs-attr">"homepage"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">"https://yourusername.github.io/your-repo-name"</span>
</code></div></div></pre></li></ul></li><li><p><strong>Deploy to GitHub Pages</strong>:</p><ul><li>Run the deploy script:<pre><div class="bg-black rounded-md"><div class="flex items-center relative text-gray-200 bg-gray-800 dark:bg-token-surface-primary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-md"><span>bash</span><button class="flex gap-1 items-center"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M12 4C10.8954 4 10 4.89543 10 6H14C14 4.89543 13.1046 4 12 4ZM8.53513 4C9.22675 2.8044 10.5194 2 12 2C13.4806 2 14.7733 2.8044 15.4649 4H17C18.6569 4 20 5.34315 20 7V19C20 20.6569 18.6569 22 17 22H7C5.34315 22 4 20.6569 4 19V7C4 5.34315 5.34315 4 7 4H8.53513ZM8 6H7C6.44772 6 6 6.44772 6 7V19C6 19.5523 6.44772 20 7 20H17C17.5523 20 18 19.5523 18 19V7C18 6.44772 17.5523 6 17 6H16C16 7.10457 15.1046 8 14 8H10C8.89543 8 8 7.10457 8 6Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></div><div class="p-4 overflow-y-auto"><code class="!whitespace-pre hljs language-bash">npm run deploy
</code></div></div></pre></li><li>This will push the contents of the <code>build</code> folder to a new branch called <code>gh-pages</code> in your GitHub repository.</li></ul></li></ol><p>After you run these steps, your React app will be live on GitHub Pages at the URL indicated in the <code>homepage</code> field of your <code>package.json</code>.</p><p>For a detailed explanation of each step or to troubleshoot any issues, you can refer back to the earlier conversation or visit the <a href="https://pages.github.com/" target="_new">GitHub Pages documentation</a> and the <a href="https://create-react-app.dev/docs/deployment/#github-pages" target="_new">Create React App deployment guide</a>.</p></div></div></div><div class="mt-1 flex justify-start gap-3 empty:hidden"><div class="flex-col gap-1 md:gap-3"><div class="flex flex-grow flex-col max-w-full"><div data-message-author-role="assistant" data-message-id="ad76d2ab-00bb-4555-94fc-8dc711a0a213" class="min-h-[20px] text-message flex flex-col items-start gap-3 whitespace-pre-wrap break-words [.text-message+&amp;]:mt-5 overflow-x-auto"><div class="markdown prose w-full break-words dark:prose-invert dark"><p>The error <code>ENOENT: no such file or directory, stat 'C:\decideSomething\build'</code> indicates that the <code>build</code> directory, which should be created when you run <code>npm run build</code>, does not exist. This typically means that the build process did not complete successfully, or the command was not run in the correct directory.</p><p>Here's what you can do to troubleshoot:</p><h3>1. Ensure You Are in the Correct Directory</h3><p>Make sure you are in the root directory of your React project when you run the build command. This is the directory where your <code>package.json</code> file is located.</p><h3>2. Run the Build Command Again</h3><p>In the root directory of your project, run the following command:</p><pre><div class="bg-black rounded-md"><div class="flex items-center relative text-gray-200 bg-gray-800 dark:bg-token-surface-primary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-md"><span>bash</span><button class="flex gap-1 items-center"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M12 4C10.8954 4 10 4.89543 10 6H14C14 4.89543 13.1046 4 12 4ZM8.53513 4C9.22675 2.8044 10.5194 2 12 2C13.4806 2 14.7733 2.8044 15.4649 4H17C18.6569 4 20 5.34315 20 7V19C20 20.6569 18.6569 22 17 22H7C5.34315 22 4 20.6569 4 19V7C4 5.34315 5.34315 4 7 4H8.53513ZM8 6H7C6.44772 6 6 6.44772 6 7V19C6 19.5523 6.44772 20 7 20H17C17.5523 20 18 19.5523 18 19V7C18 6.44772 17.5523 6 17 6H16C16 7.10457 15.1046 8 14 8H10C8.89543 8 8 7.10457 8 6Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></div><div class="p-4 overflow-y-auto"><code class="!whitespace-pre hljs language-bash">npm run build
</code></div></div></pre><p>This command should create a <code>build</code> directory in your project folder with all the static files.</p><h3>3. Check for Build Scripts</h3><p>Ensure that your <code>package.json</code> file has the correct "build" script. It should look something like this:</p><pre><div class="bg-black rounded-md"><div class="flex items-center relative text-gray-200 bg-gray-800 dark:bg-token-surface-primary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-md"><span>json</span><button class="flex gap-1 items-center"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M12 4C10.8954 4 10 4.89543 10 6H14C14 4.89543 13.1046 4 12 4ZM8.53513 4C9.22675 2.8044 10.5194 2 12 2C13.4806 2 14.7733 2.8044 15.4649 4H17C18.6569 4 20 5.34315 20 7V19C20 20.6569 18.6569 22 17 22H7C5.34315 22 4 20.6569 4 19V7C4 5.34315 5.34315 4 7 4H8.53513ZM8 6H7C6.44772 6 6 6.44772 6 7V19C6 19.5523 6.44772 20 7 20H17C17.5523 20 18 19.5523 18 19V7C18 6.44772 17.5523 6 17 6H16C16 7.10457 15.1046 8 14 8H10C8.89543 8 8 7.10457 8 6Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></div><div class="p-4 overflow-y-auto"><code class="!whitespace-pre hljs language-json"><span class="hljs-attr">"scripts"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-punctuation">{</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"start"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">"react-scripts start"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"build"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">"react-scripts build"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-comment">// ... other scripts</span>
<span class="hljs-punctuation">}</span>
</code></div></div></pre><h3>4. Check for Build Errors</h3><p>If the <code>build</code> command results in errors, read through the error messages for clues as to what went wrong. Common issues might include:</p><ul><li>Syntax errors or other problems in your code.</li><li>Missing dependencies or issues in <code>package.json</code>.</li><li>Configuration issues in tools like Babel, Webpack, etc.</li></ul><h3>5. Ensure <code>react-scripts</code> Is Installed</h3><p>The <code>react-scripts</code> package should be installed as it's used to build the app. If it's missing, you'll need to install it:</p><pre><div class="bg-black rounded-md"><div class="flex items-center relative text-gray-200 bg-gray-800 dark:bg-token-surface-primary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-md"><span>bash</span><button class="flex gap-1 items-center"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M12 4C10.8954 4 10 4.89543 10 6H14C14 4.89543 13.1046 4 12 4ZM8.53513 4C9.22675 2.8044 10.5194 2 12 2C13.4806 2 14.7733 2.8044 15.4649 4H17C18.6569 4 20 5.34315 20 7V19C20 20.6569 18.6569 22 17 22H7C5.34315 22 4 20.6569 4 19V7C4 5.34315 5.34315 4 7 4H8.53513ZM8 6H7C6.44772 6 6 6.44772 6 7V19C6 19.5523 6.44772 20 7 20H17C17.5523 20 18 19.5523 18 19V7C18 6.44772 17.5523 6 17 6H16C16 7.10457 15.1046 8 14 8H10C8.89543 8 8 7.10457 8 6Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></div><div class="p-4 overflow-y-auto"><code class="!whitespace-pre hljs language-bash">npm install react-scripts --save
</code></div></div></pre><h3>6. Clear the npm Cache and Reinstall Node Modules</h3><p>Sometimes, the npm cache can cause issues. You can try clearing it and reinstalling your <code>node_modules</code>:</p><pre><div class="bg-black rounded-md"><div class="flex items-center relative text-gray-200 bg-gray-800 dark:bg-token-surface-primary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-md"><span>bash</span><button class="flex gap-1 items-center"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M12 4C10.8954 4 10 4.89543 10 6H14C14 4.89543 13.1046 4 12 4ZM8.53513 4C9.22675 2.8044 10.5194 2 12 2C13.4806 2 14.7733 2.8044 15.4649 4H17C18.6569 4 20 5.34315 20 7V19C20 20.6569 18.6569 22 17 22H7C5.34315 22 4 20.6569 4 19V7C4 5.34315 5.34315 4 7 4H8.53513ZM8 6H7C6.44772 6 6 6.44772 6 7V19C6 19.5523 6.44772 20 7 20H17C17.5523 20 18 19.5523 18 19V7C18 6.44772 17.5523 6 17 6H16C16 7.10457 15.1046 8 14 8H10C8.89543 8 8 7.10457 8 6Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></div><div class="p-4 overflow-y-auto"><code class="!whitespace-pre hljs language-bash">npm cache clean --force
<span class="hljs-built_in">rm</span> -rf node_modules
<span class="hljs-built_in">rm</span> package-lock.json
npm install
</code></div></div></pre><p>After running these steps, try to build your project again with <code>npm run build</code>. If the build is successful, the <code>build</code> directory should be present, and you can proceed with the deployment to GitHub Pages using the <code>gh-pages</code> package.</p><p>If you continue to encounter issues, please refer to the error messages provided in the terminal for more specific troubleshooting steps, or consider seeking additional support with the full error log and details about your project structure.</p></div></div></div><div class="mt-1 flex justify-start gap-3 empty:hidden"><div class="text-gray-400 flex self-end lg:self-center justify-center lg:justify-start mt-0 text-message flex flex-col items-start gap-3 whitespace-pre-wrap break-words [.text-message+&amp;]:mt-5 overflow-x-auto"><div class="markdown prose w-full break-words dark:prose-invert dark"><p>The root directory of a React project is typically where your project's <code>package.json</code> file resides. This directory is the one that you initially set up when you created the project, often with <code>create-react-app</code> or another scaffolding tool.</p><p>Here's how you can find the root directory of your React project:</p><h3>If You Have the Project Open in an IDE or Code Editor:</h3><ol><li>Open your code editor (like Visual Studio Code, Atom, Sublime Text, etc.).</li><li>Look for the directory (also known as a folder) in the editor's file explorer where you can see the <code>package.json</code> file listed.</li></ol><h3>Using the Command Line:</h3><ol><li>Open a command prompt (on Windows) or a terminal (on macOS or Linux).</li><li>Navigate to the directory you believe to be the root of your React project using the <code>cd</code> (change directory) command.</li><li>Once you're in a directory, you can list the contents to check for the <code>package.json</code> file by running <code>dir</code> on Windows or <code>ls</code> on macOS/Linux.</li></ol><p>For example:</p><pre><div class="bg-black rounded-md"><div class="flex items-center relative text-gray-200 bg-gray-800 dark:bg-token-surface-primary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-md"><span>bash</span><button class="flex gap-1 items-center"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M12 4C10.8954 4 10 4.89543 10 6H14C14 4.89543 13.1046 4 12 4ZM8.53513 4C9.22675 2.8044 10.5194 2 12 2C13.4806 2 14.7733 2.8044 15.4649 4H17C18.6569 4 20 5.34315 20 7V19C20 20.6569 18.6569 22 17 22H7C5.34315 22 4 20.6569 4 19V7C4 5.34315 5.34315 4 7 4H8.53513ZM8 6H7C6.44772 6 6 6.44772 6 7V19C6 19.5523 6.44772 20 7 20H17C17.5523 20 18 19.5523 18 19V7C18 6.44772 17.5523 6 17 6H16C16 7.10457 15.1046 8 14 8H10C8.89543 8 8 7.10457 8 6Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></div><div class="p-4 overflow-y-auto"><code class="!whitespace-pre hljs language-bash"><span class="hljs-built_in">cd</span> path/to/your/project
<span class="hljs-built_in">ls</span>  <span class="hljs-comment"># or 'dir' if you are on Windows</span>
</code></div></div></pre><p>You should see <code>package.json</code> in the list of files if you are in the root directory.</p><h3>If You Used <code>create-react-app</code>:</h3><p>If you set up your project with <code>create-react-app</code>, the root directory is where you ran the command to create the app. It's usually named after your project. For example, if you created a project with:</p><pre><div class="bg-black rounded-md"><div class="flex items-center relative text-gray-200 bg-gray-800 dark:bg-token-surface-primary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-md"><span>bash</span><button class="flex gap-1 items-center"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M12 4C10.8954 4 10 4.89543 10 6H14C14 4.89543 13.1046 4 12 4ZM8.53513 4C9.22675 2.8044 10.5194 2 12 2C13.4806 2 14.7733 2.8044 15.4649 4H17C18.6569 4 20 5.34315 20 7V19C20 20.6569 18.6569 22 17 22H7C5.34315 22 4 20.6569 4 19V7C4 5.34315 5.34315 4 7 4H8.53513ZM8 6H7C6.44772 6 6 6.44772 6 7V19C6 19.5523 6.44772 20 7 20H17C17.5523 20 18 19.5523 18 19V7C18 6.44772 17.5523 6 17 6H16C16 7.10457 15.1046 8 14 8H10C8.89543 8 8 7.10457 8 6Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></div><div class="p-4 overflow-y-auto"><code class="!whitespace-pre hljs language-bash">npx create-react-app my-app
</code></div></div></pre><p>The root directory would be the <code>my-app</code> directory.</p><h3>Check for Key Project Files:</h3><p>The root directory will usually include the following files and directories:</p><ul><li><code>package.json</code> - Contains npm configuration, scripts, and project dependencies.</li><li><code>public/</code> - Contains the public assets like <code>index.html</code>, icons, etc.</li><li><code>src/</code> - Contains the source files for your React components, styles, tests, etc.</li><li><code>node_modules/</code> - Contains all the installed npm packages.</li><li><code>.git/</code> - If the project is a Git repository, this hidden directory stores the Git configuration and history.</li></ul><p>If you find these files and directories, you are likely in the root directory of your React project.</p></div></div></div><div class="mt-1 flex justify-start gap-3 empty:hidden"><div class="text-gray-400 flex self-end tool, not Create React App, which uses <code>react-scripts</code>. The scripts for Vite are a little different but look correct based on standard Vite configuration.</p><p>Here's a breakdown of your scripts:</p><ul><li><code>"dev": "vite"</code>: Runs the Vite development server.</li><li><code>"build": "vite build"</code>: Builds your app for production.</li><li><code>"lint": "eslint . --ext js,jsx --report-unused-disable-directives --max-warnings 0"</code>: Runs ESLint to check for linting errors in your <code>.js</code> and <code>.jsx</code> files.</li><li><code>"preview": "vite preview"</code>: Serves the production build locally for previewing.</li><li><code>"predeploy": "npm run build"</code>: Before deploying, this script ensures that your app is built.</li><li><code>"deploy": "gh-pages -d build"</code>: Deploys the content of the <code>build</code> directory to GitHub Pages.</li></ul><p>Your build script is using Vite to build the app, so the error you encountered (<code>ENOENT: no such file or directory, stat 'C:\decideSomething\build'</code>) means that either the build process didn't run successfully, or it was not run at all.</p><p>To fix the issue, you should ensure that you're in the project root data-message-author-role="assistant" data-message-id="5416ddfb-9054-4c34-ac0b-b59dc502aaf4" class="min-h-[20px] text-message flex flex-col items-start gap-3 whitespace-pre-wrap break-words [.text-message+&amp;]:mt-5 overflow-x-auto"><div class="markdown prose w-full break-words dark:prose-invert dark"><p>The screenshot indicates that you've uploaded individual project files to your GitHub repository, but for GitHub Pages to serve your React application, you need to deploy the built static files.</p><p>When you run <code>npm run build</code>, Vite creates a <code>dist</code> folder (not <code>build</code> as in Create React App) that contains the production version of your app. This <code>dist</code> folder is what needs to be deployed to GitHub Pages, not the individual source files like <code>App.jsx</code>.</p><p>Here's what you should do:</p><ol><li><p><strong>Generate the Production Build</strong>:
Run <code>npm run build</code> in your project's root directory to generate the <code>dist</code> folder with the production build.</p></li><li><p><strong>Deploy to GitHub Pages</strong>:
Since you are using Vite, make sure your <code>package.json</code> is set up correctly for deployment. You mentioned using the <code>gh-pages</code> package, so you should have a "deploy" script in your <code>package.json</code> that looks something like this:</p><pre><div class="bg-black rounded-md"><div class="flex items-center relative text-gray-200 bg-gray-800 dark:bg-token-surface-primary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-md"><span>json</span><button class="flex gap-1 items-center"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M12 4C10.8954 4 10 4.89543 10 6H14C14 4.89543 13.1046 4 12 4ZM8.53513 4C9.22675 2.8044 10.5194 2 12 2C13.4806 2 14.7733 2.8044 15.4649 4H17C18.6569 4 20 5.34315 20 7V19C20 20.6569 18.6569 22 17 22H7C5.34315 22 4 20.6569 4 19V7C4 5.34315 5.34315 4 7 4H8.53513ZM8 6H7C6.44772 6 6 6.44772 6 7V19C6 19.5523 6.44772 20 7 20H17C17.5523 20 18 19.5523 18 19V7C18 6.44772 17.5523 6 17 6H16C16 7.10457 15.1046 8 14 8H10C8.89543 8 8 7.10457 8 6Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></div><div class="p-4 overflow-y-auto"><code class="!whitespace-pre hljs language-json"><span class="hljs-attr">"scripts"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-punctuation">{</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"deploy"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">"gh-pages -d dist"</span>
<span class="hljs-punctuation">}</span>
</code></div></div></pre><p>Then run:</p><pre><div class="bg-black rounded-md"><div class="flex items-center relative text-gray-200 bg-gray-800 dark:bg-token-surface-primary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-md"><span>bash</span><button class="flex gap-1 items-center"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M12 4C10.8954 4 10 4.89543 10 6H14C14 4.89543 13.1046 4 12 4ZM8.53513 4C9.22675 2.8044 10.5194 2 12 2C13.4806 2 14.7733 2.8044 15.4649 4H17C18.6569 4 20 5.34315 20 7V19C20 20.6569 18.6569 22 17 22H7C5.34315 22 4 20.6569 4 19V7C4 5.34315 5.34315 4 7 4H8.53513ZM8 6H7C6.44772 6 6 6.44772 6 7V19C6 19.5523 6.44772 20 7 20H17C17.5523 20 18 19.5523 18 19V7C18 6.44772 17.5523 6 17 6H16C16 7.10457 15.1046 8 14 8H10C8.89543 8 8 7.10457 8 6Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></div><div class="p-4 overflow-y-auto"><code class="!whitespace-pre hljs language-bash">npm run deploy
</code></div></div></pre><p>This will push the contents of the <code>dist</code> directory to the <code>gh-pages</code> branch of your repository.</p></li><li><p><strong>Configure GitHub Repository for Pages</strong>:
Go to your repository settings on GitHub, navigate to the "Pages" section, and configure the source to use the <code>gh-pages</code> branch.</p></li><li><p><strong>Do Not Manually Upload <code>dist</code> Files</strong>:
You shouldn't manually upload the <code>dist</code> folder to your repository. The <code>gh-pages</code> package takes care of this for you.</p></li><li><p><strong>Check Your Repository After Deployment</strong>:
After running the deployment script, your repository should have a <code>gh-pages</code> branch containing only the contents of the <code>dist</code> folder.</p></li><li><p><strong>Access Your Site</strong>:
Once everything is set up, and the <code>gh-pages</code> branch is populated with your build, your site should be accessible at <code>https://&lt;username&gt;.github.io/&lt;repository-name&gt;</code>, replacing <code>&lt;username&gt;</code> with your GitHub username and <code>&lt;repository-name&gt;</code> with the name of your GitHub repository.</p></li></ol><p>If you’ve done all of this and your page is still not displaying correctly, ensure that you don’t have any path issues in your Vite configuration or your code, which might cause resources to fail to load on GitHub [.text-message+&amp;]:mt-5 overflow-x-auto"><div class="markdown prose w-full break-words dark:prose-invert dark"><p>The error <code>spawn git ENOENT</code> typically indicates that Node.js cannot find the Git executable in your environment. This can happen if Git is either not installed on your system or if its path is not included in your system's PATH environment variable. Here are the steps to troubleshoot this issue:</p><h3>1. Check if Git is Installed:</h3><p>Open a command prompt or terminal and type <code>git --version</code> to check if Git is installed and available in the PATH. You should see the version number of Git if it's installed. If you get an error or a message saying that 'git' is not recognized, you need to install Git.</p><h3>2. Install Git:</h3><p>If Git is not installed, download and install it from the <a href="https://git-scm.com/downloads" target="_new">official Git website</a>. During installation, make sure to select the option that says "Add Git to PATH".</p><h3>3. Verify Git Installation:</h3><p>After installation, restart your command prompt or terminal and run <code>git --version</code> again to verify that Git is now recognized.</p><h3>4. Set Git Configuration (Optional):</h3><p>If Git is installed but you're still seeing the error, it might be related to missing Git configuration. Set your Git username and email by running these commands in your terminal:</p><pre><div class="bg-black rounded-md"><div class="flex items-center relative text-gray-200 bg-gray-800 dark:bg-token-surface-primary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-md"><span>bash</span><button class="flex gap-1 items-center"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M12 4C10.8954 4 10 4.89543 10 6H14C14 4.89543 13.1046 4 12 4ZM8.53513 4C9.22675 2.8044 10.5194 2 12 2C13.4806 2 14.7733 2.8044 15.4649 4H17C18.6569 4 20 5.34315 20 7V19C20 20.6569 18.6569 22 17 22H7C5.34315 22 4 20.6569 4 19V7C4 5.34315 5.34315 4 7 4H8.53513ZM8 6H7C6.44772 6 6 6.44772 6 7V19C6 19.5523 6.44772 20 7 20H17C17.5523 20 18 19.5523 18 19V7C18 6.44772 17.5523 6 17 6H16C16 7.10457 15.1046 8 14 8H10C8.89543 8 8 7.10457 8 6Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></div><div class="p-4 overflow-y-auto"><code class="!whitespace-pre hljs language-bash">git config --global user.name <span class="hljs-string">"Your Name"</span>
git config --global user.email <span class="hljs-string">"your.email@example.com"</span>
</code></div></div></pre><p>Replace <code>"Your Name"</code> with your actual name and <code>"your.email@example.com"</code> with your actual email address. These are used for Git commits.</p><h3>5. Retry Deployment:</h3><p>After ensuring that Git is properly installed and configured, go back to the root directory of your React project and try running <code>npm run deploy</code> again.</p><p>These steps should resolve the <code>spawn git ENOENT</code> error, allowing the <code>gh-pages</code> package to run the necessary Git commands to deploy your site to GitHub Pages. If you encounter further issues, make sure that your local Git repository is correctly set up and that you have the necessary permissions to push to the repository on GitHub.</p></div></div></div><div [.text-message+&amp;]:mt-5 overflow-x-auto"><div class="markdown prose w-full break-words dark:prose-invert dark"><p>For an ASUS VivoBook 15, which is likely to be a 64-bit machine, you should choose the 64-bit Git for Windows Setup. Most modern computers are 64-bit, and this version will work best with your system. The 32-bit version is typically for older computers.</p><p>Here's what each option means:</p><ul><li><p><strong>Standalone Installer</strong>: This installer will install Git directly onto your system and is the most common way to get Git up and running on your machine. It integrates with the Windows shell (Explorer) and the Windows Command Prompt.</p></li><li><p><strong>Portable ("thumbdrive edition")</strong>: This version is designed to run from a USB flash drive or other portable storage device. It's useful if you want to carry Git with you and use it on multiple computers without installing it on each one.</p></li></ul><p>Unless you have a specific need for the portable version, go with the <strong>64-bit Git for Windows Setup</strong> for a straightforward installation on your laptop. You can download it from the <a href="https://git-scm.com/download/win" target="_new">official Git website</a>. During installation, you can accept the default settings, but pay attention to the step that asks about the PATH environment variable and make sure you select the option to add Git to the PATH. This will allow you to run Git from the Command Prompt or PowerShell.</p></div></div></div><div class="mt-1 flex justify-start gap-3 empty:hidden"><div class="text-gray-400 flex self-end class="markdown prose w-full break-words dark:prose-invert dark"><p>Now that you have Git installed and you've confirmed it's working by checking the version, you don't need to start from <code>npm run build</code> again if you've already successfully built your project.</p><p>The <code>npm run build</code> command is used to create a production build of your React app, which you've already done. Since the build is already complete and assuming you haven't made changes to your code that would require a rebuild, you can proceed directly to the deployment step.</p><p>Here's what you do next:</p><ol><li><p><strong>Verify the Build</strong>: Ensure the <code>dist</code> directory (Vite's default build output folder) exists in your project and contains the built files.</p></li><li><p><strong>Deploy to GitHub Pages</strong>: Run the deployment command:</p><pre><div class="bg-black rounded-md"><div class="flex items-center relative text-gray-200 bg-gray-800 dark:bg-token-surface-primary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-md"><span>bash</span><button class="flex gap-1 items-center"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M12 4C10.8954 4 10 4.89543 10 6H14C14 4.89543 13.1046 4 12 4ZM8.53513 4C9.22675 2.8044 10.5194 2 12 2C13.4806 2 14.7733 2.8044 15.4649 4H17C18.6569 4 20 5.34315 20 7V19C20 20.6569 18.6569 22 17 22H7C5.34315 22 4 20.6569 4 19V7C4 5.34315 5.34315 4 7 4H8.53513ZM8 6H7C6.44772 6 6 6.44772 6 7V19C6 19.5523 6.44772 20 7 20H17C17.5523 20 18 19.5523 18 19V7C18 6.44772 17.5523 6 17 6H16C16 7.10457 15.1046 8 14 8H10C8.89543 8 8 7.10457 8 6Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></div><div class="p-4 overflow-y-auto"><code class="!whitespace-pre hljs language-bash">npm run deploy
</code></div></div></pre></li></ol><p>This command will push the contents of your <code>dist</code> directory to the <code>gh-pages</code> branch of your GitHub repository. After running this command, GitHub Pages will serve the contents of this branch as your website.</p><p>Remember, the <code>gh-pages</code> branch is specifically for the built, static files, not your source files. The <code>gh-pages</code> npm package should handle the process of creating this branch and pushing to it, so you don't need to manually deal with the <code>dist</code> directory in your main branch.</p><p>Once deployment is successful, your site should be available at <code>https://&lt;username&gt;.github.io/&lt;repository-name&gt;</code>, replacing <code>&lt;username&gt;</code> with your GitHub username and <code>&lt;repository-name&gt;</code> with the name of your GitHub repository. It might take a few minutes for the changes to go live after you deploy.</p></div></div></div><div class="mt-1 flex justify-start gap-3 empty:hidden"><div class="text-gray-400 flex self-end text-message flex flex-col items-start gap-3 whitespace-pre-wrap break-words [.text-message+&amp;]:mt-5 overflow-x-auto"><div class="markdown prose w-full break-words dark:prose-invert dark"><p>This error message indicates that the <code>gh-pages</code> script is trying to push your <code>dist</code> directory to a remote repository named "origin," but it can't find the repository URL. This typically happens if the local git repository isn't properly linked to a remote GitHub repository, or if there's no git repository initialized.</p><p>Here's what you need to do to resolve this:</p><h3>1. Initialize a Git Repository (if not already done):</h3><p>If you haven't already initialized your project directory as a git repository, you'll need to do so. Navigate to your project's root directory in the command line and run:</p><pre><div class="bg-black rounded-md"><div class="flex items-center relative text-gray-200 bg-gray-800 dark:bg-token-surface-primary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-md"><span>bash</span><button class="flex gap-1 items-center"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M12 4C10.8954 4 10 4.89543 10 6H14C14 4.89543 13.1046 4 12 4ZM8.53513 4C9.22675 2.8044 10.5194 2 12 2C13.4806 2 14.7733 2.8044 15.4649 4H17C18.6569 4 20 5.34315 20 7V19C20 20.6569 18.6569 22 17 22H7C5.34315 22 4 20.6569 4 19V7C4 5.34315 5.34315 4 7 4H8.53513ZM8 6H7C6.44772 6 6 6.44772 6 7V19C6 19.5523 6.44772 20 7 20H17C17.5523 20 18 19.5523 18 19V7C18 6.44772 17.5523 6 17 6H16C16 7.10457 15.1046 8 14 8H10C8.89543 8 8 7.10457 8 6Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></div><div class="p-4 overflow-y-auto"><code class="!whitespace-pre hljs language-bash">git init
</code></div></div></pre><h3>2. Add the Remote Repository:</h3><p>Link your local git repository to your GitHub repository by using the <code>git remote add</code> command. Replace <code>&lt;username&gt;</code> with your GitHub username and <code>&lt;repository-name&gt;</code> with the name of your GitHub repository:</p><pre><div class="bg-black rounded-md"><div class="flex items-center relative text-gray-200 bg-gray-800 dark:bg-token-surface-primary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-md"><span>bash</span><button class="flex gap-1 items-center"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M12 4C10.8954 4 10 4.89543 10 6H14C14 4.89543 13.1046 4 12 4ZM8.53513 4C9.22675 2.8044 10.5194 2 12 2C13.4806 2 14.7733 2.8044 15.4649 4H17C18.6569 4 20 5.34315 20 7V19C20 20.6569 18.6569 22 17 22H7C5.34315 22 4 20.6569 4 19V7C4 5.34315 5.34315 4 7 4H8.53513ZM8 6H7C6.44772 6 6 6.44772 6 7V19C6 19.5523 6.44772 20 7 20H17C17.5523 20 18 19.5523 18 19V7C18 6.44772 17.5523 6 17 6H16C16 7.10457 15.1046 8 14 8H10C8.89543 8 8 7.10457 8 6Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></div><div class="p-4 overflow-y-auto"><code class="!whitespace-pre hljs language-bash">git remote add origin https://github.com/&lt;username&gt;/&lt;repository-name&gt;.git
</code></div></div></pre><h3>3. Confirm the Remote Repository:</h3><p>Ensure that you've successfully added the remote repository by running:</p><pre><div class="bg-black rounded-md"><div class="flex items-center relative text-gray-200 bg-gray-800 dark:bg-token-surface-primary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-md"><span>bash</span><button class="flex gap-1 items-center"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M12 4C10.8954 4 10 4.89543 10 6H14C14 4.89543 13.1046 4 12 4ZM8.53513 4C9.22675 2.8044 10.5194 2 12 2C13.4806 2 14.7733 2.8044 15.4649 4H17C18.6569 4 20 5.34315 20 7V19C20 20.6569 18.6569 22 17 22H7C5.34315 22 4 20.6569 4 19V7C4 5.34315 5.34315 4 7 4H8.53513ZM8 6H7C6.44772 6 6 6.44772 6 7V19C6 19.5523 6.44772 20 7 20H17C17.5523 20 18 19.5523 18 19V7C18 6.44772 17.5523 6 17 6H16C16 7.10457 15.1046 8 14 8H10C8.89543 8 8 7.10457 8 6Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></div><div class="p-4 overflow-y-auto"><code class="!whitespace-pre hljs language-bash">git remote -v
</code></div></div></pre><p>You should see the URL of your GitHub repository listed under "origin."</p><h3>4. Make an Initial Commit (if not already done):</h3><p>If you haven't made any commits to your repository, you should at least commit your source files before deploying. Add your files and make your initial commit:</p><pre><div class="bg-black rounded-md"><div class="flex items-center relative text-gray-200 bg-gray-800 dark:bg-token-surface-primary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-md"><span>bash</span><button class="flex gap-1 items-center"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M12 4C10.8954 4 10 4.89543 10 6H14C14 4.89543 13.1046 4 12 4ZM8.53513 4C9.22675 2.8044 10.5194 2 12 2C13.4806 2 14.7733 2.8044 15.4649 4H17C18.6569 4 20 5.34315 20 7V19C20 20.6569 18.6569 22 17 22H7C5.34315 22 4 20.6569 4 19V7C4 5.34315 5.34315 4 7 4H8.53513ZM8 6H7C6.44772 6 6 6.44772 6 7V19C6 19.5523 6.44772 20 7 20H17C17.5523 20 18 19.5523 18 19V7C18 6.44772 17.5523 6 17 6H16C16 7.10457 15.1046 8 14 8H10C8.89543 8 8 7.10457 8 6Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></div><div class="p-4 overflow-y-auto"><code class="!whitespace-pre hljs language-bash">git add .
git commit -m <span class="hljs-string">"Initial commit"</span>
</code></div></div></pre><h3>5. Push to GitHub (if not already done):</h3><p>Push your initial commit to GitHub:</p><pre><div class="bg-black rounded-md"><div class="flex items-center relative text-gray-200 bg-gray-800 dark:bg-token-surface-primary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-md"><span>bash</span><button class="flex gap-1 items-center"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M12 4C10.8954 4 10 4.89543 10 6H14C14 4.89543 13.1046 4 12 4ZM8.53513 4C9.22675 2.8044 10.5194 2 12 2C13.4806 2 14.7733 2.8044 15.4649 4H17C18.6569 4 20 5.34315 20 7V19C20 20.6569 18.6569 22 17 22H7C5.34315 22 4 20.6569 4 19V7C4 5.34315 5.34315 4 7 4H8.53513ZM8 6H7C6.44772 6 6 6.44772 6 7V19C6 19.5523 6.44772 20 7 20H17C17.5523 20 18 19.5523 18 19V7C18 6.44772 17.5523 6 17 6H16C16 7.10457 15.1046 8 14 8H10C8.89543 8 8 7.10457 8 6Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></div><div class="p-4 overflow-y-auto"><code class="!whitespace-pre hljs language-bash">git push -u origin main
</code></div></div></pre><p>Replace <code>main</code> with <code>master</code> if your default branch is named master.</p><h3>6. Run the Deploy Script Again:</h3><p>Now that your local repository is properly set up and linked to the remote GitHub repository, try running the deploy script again:</p><pre><div class="bg-black rounded-md"><div class="flex items-center relative text-gray-200 bg-gray-800 dark:bg-token-surface-primary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-md"><span>bash</span><button class="flex gap-1 items-center"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M12 4C10.8954 4 10 4.89543 10 6H14C14 4.89543 13.1046 4 12 4ZM8.53513 4C9.22675 2.8044 10.5194 2 12 2C13.4806 2 14.7733 2.8044 15.4649 4H17C18.6569 4 20 5.34315 20 7V19C20 20.6569 18.6569 22 17 22H7C5.34315 22 4 20.6569 4 19V7C4 5.34315 5.34315 4 7 4H8.53513ZM8 6H7C6.44772 6 6 6.44772 6 7V19C6 19.5523 6.44772 20 7 20H17C17.5523 20 18 19.5523 18 19V7C18 6.44772 17.5523 6 17 6H16C16 7.10457 15.1046 8 14 8H10C8.89543 8 8 7.10457 8 6Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></div><div class="p-4 overflow-y-auto"><code class="!whitespace-pre hljs language-bash">npm run deploy
</code></div></div></pre><p>This should now successfully push the contents of the <code>dist</code> directory to the <code>gh-pages</code> branch of your remote repository.</p><p>If the error persists, double-check that the remote repository URL is correct, and ensure that you've followed all the GitHub setup steps, including creating a repository on GitHub and having the correct access class="flex-col gap-1 md:gap-3"><div class="flex flex-grow flex-col max-w-full"><div data-message-author-role="assistant" data-message-id="9f4e52ef-a541-4c25-b15d-dcfa9afad618" class="min-h-[20px] text-message flex flex-col items-start gap-3 whitespace-pre-wrap break-words [.text-message+&amp;]:mt-5 overflow-x-auto"><div class="markdown prose w-full break-words dark:prose-invert dark"><p>The error message <code>error: src refspec main does not match any</code> suggests that the <code>main</code> branch does not exist or that there are no commits on it. This can occur if you have not yet committed any files to your local repository, or if your default branch has a different name.</p><p>Here are the steps to fix this:</p><h3>1. Check for Commits</h3><p>First, ensure you have made at least one commit. In the root directory of your project, run:</p><pre><div class="bg-black rounded-md"><div class="flex items-center relative text-gray-200 bg-gray-800 dark:bg-token-surface-primary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-md"><span>bash</span><button class="flex gap-1 items-center"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M12 4C10.8954 4 10 4.89543 10 6H14C14 4.89543 13.1046 4 12 4ZM8.53513 4C9.22675 2.8044 10.5194 2 12 2C13.4806 2 14.7733 2.8044 15.4649 4H17C18.6569 4 20 5.34315 20 7V19C20 20.6569 18.6569 22 17 22H7C5.34315 22 4 20.6569 4 19V7C4 5.34315 5.34315 4 7 4H8.53513ZM8 6H7C6.44772 6 6 6.44772 6 7V19C6 19.5523 6.44772 20 7 20H17C17.5523 20 18 19.5523 18 19V7C18 6.44772 17.5523 6 17 6H16C16 7.10457 15.1046 8 14 8H10C8.89543 8 8 7.10457 8 6Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></div><div class="p-4 overflow-y-auto"><code class="!whitespace-pre hljs language-bash">git status
</code></div></div></pre><p>If there are uncommitted changes, you will need to commit them:</p><pre><div class="bg-black rounded-md"><div class="flex items-center relative text-gray-200 bg-gray-800 dark:bg-token-surface-primary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-md"><span>bash</span><button class="flex gap-1 items-center"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M12 4C10.8954 4 10 4.89543 10 6H14C14 4.89543 13.1046 4 12 4ZM8.53513 4C9.22675 2.8044 10.5194 2 12 2C13.4806 2 14.7733 2.8044 15.4649 4H17C18.6569 4 20 5.34315 20 7V19C20 20.6569 18.6569 22 17 22H7C5.34315 22 4 20.6569 4 19V7C4 5.34315 5.34315 4 7 4H8.53513ZM8 6H7C6.44772 6 6 6.44772 6 7V19C6 19.5523 6.44772 20 7 20H17C17.5523 20 18 19.5523 18 19V7C18 6.44772 17.5523 6 17 6H16C16 7.10457 15.1046 8 14 8H10C8.89543 8 8 7.10457 8 6Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></div><div class="p-4 overflow-y-auto"><code class="!whitespace-pre hljs language-bash">git add .
git commit -m <span class="hljs-string">"Initial commit"</span>
</code></div></div></pre><h3>2. Check Branch Name</h3><p>Check the current branch name using:</p><pre><div class="bg-black rounded-md"><div class="flex items-center relative text-gray-200 bg-gray-800 dark:bg-token-surface-primary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-md"><span>bash</span><button class="flex gap-1 items-center"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M12 4C10.8954 4 10 4.89543 10 6H14C14 4.89543 13.1046 4 12 4ZM8.53513 4C9.22675 2.8044 10.5194 2 12 2C13.4806 2 14.7733 2.8044 15.4649 4H17C18.6569 4 20 5.34315 20 7V19C20 20.6569 18.6569 22 17 22H7C5.34315 22 4 20.6569 4 19V7C4 5.34315 5.34315 4 7 4H8.53513ZM8 6H7C6.44772 6 6 6.44772 6 7V19C6 19.5523 6.44772 20 7 20H17C17.5523 20 18 19.5523 18 19V7C18 6.44772 17.5523 6 17 6H16C16 7.10457 15.1046 8 14 8H10C8.89543 8 8 7.10457 8 6Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></div><div class="p-4 overflow-y-auto"><code class="!whitespace-pre hljs language-bash">git branch
</code></div></div></pre><p>The default branch name for new repositories can be <code>main</code> or <code>master</code>, depending on your Git settings or the settings of the platform you're using (like GitHub). If you see a branch named <code>master</code> instead of <code>main</code>, that's probably your default branch.</p><h3>3. Push to the Correct Branch</h3><p>If your branch is indeed <code>main</code>, try pushing again with:</p><pre><div class="bg-black rounded-md"><div class="flex items-center relative text-gray-200 bg-gray-800 dark:bg-token-surface-primary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-md"><span>bash</span><button class="flex gap-1 items-center"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M12 4C10.8954 4 10 4.89543 10 6H14C14 4.89543 13.1046 4 12 4ZM8.53513 4C9.22675 2.8044 10.5194 2 12 2C13.4806 2 14.7733 2.8044 15.4649 4H17C18.6569 4 20 5.34315 20 7V19C20 20.6569 18.6569 22 17 22H7C5.34315 22 4 20.6569 4 19V7C4 5.34315 5.34315 4 7 4H8.53513ZM8 6H7C6.44772 6 6 6.44772 6 7V19C6 19.5523 6.44772 20 7 20H17C17.5523 20 18 19.5523 18 19V7C18 6.44772 17.5523 6 17 6H16C16 7.10457 15.1046 8 14 8H10C8.89543 8 8 7.10457 8 6Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></div><div class="p-4 overflow-y-auto"><code class="!whitespace-pre hljs language-bash">git push -u origin main
</code></div></div></pre><p>If it's <code>master</code> or any other name, push to that branch instead:</p><pre><div class="bg-black rounded-md"><div class="flex items-center relative text-gray-200 bg-gray-800 dark:bg-token-surface-primary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-md"><span>bash</span><button class="flex gap-1 items-center"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M12 4C10.8954 4 10 4.89543 10 6H14C14 4.89543 13.1046 4 12 4ZM8.53513 4C9.22675 2.8044 10.5194 2 12 2C13.4806 2 14.7733 2.8044 15.4649 4H17C18.6569 4 20 5.34315 20 7V19C20 20.6569 18.6569 22 17 22H7C5.34315 22 4 20.6569 4 19V7C4 5.34315 5.34315 4 7 4H8.53513ZM8 6H7C6.44772 6 6 6.44772 6 7V19C6 19.5523 6.44772 20 7 20H17C17.5523 20 18 19.5523 18 19V7C18 6.44772 17.5523 6 17 6H16C16 7.10457 15.1046 8 14 8H10C8.89543 8 8 7.10457 8 6Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></div><div class="p-4 overflow-y-auto"><code class="!whitespace-pre hljs language-bash">git push -u origin master
</code></div></div></pre><p>Or for a different branch name:</p><pre><div class="bg-black rounded-md"><div class="flex items-center relative text-gray-200 bg-gray-800 dark:bg-token-surface-primary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-md"><span>bash</span><button class="flex gap-1 items-center"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M12 4C10.8954 4 10 4.89543 10 6H14C14 4.89543 13.1046 4 12 4ZM8.53513 4C9.22675 2.8044 10.5194 2 12 2C13.4806 2 14.7733 2.8044 15.4649 4H17C18.6569 4 20 5.34315 20 7V19C20 20.6569 18.6569 22 17 22H7C5.34315 22 4 20.6569 4 19V7C4 5.34315 5.34315 4 7 4H8.53513ZM8 6H7C6.44772 6 6 6.44772 6 7V19C6 19.5523 6.44772 20 7 20H17C17.5523 20 18 19.5523 18 19V7C18 6.44772 17.5523 6 17 6H16C16 7.10457 15.1046 8 14 8H10C8.89543 8 8 7.10457 8 6Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></div><div class="p-4 overflow-y-auto"><code class="!whitespace-pre hljs language-bash">git push -u origin your-branch-name
</code></div></div></pre><p>The <code>-u</code> flag sets the upstream for your branch, linking it to the remote branch, so in the future, you can just run <code>git push</code> without specifying the branch.</p><h3>4. Create the Branch if Necessary</h3><p>If for some reason the branch does not exist (which is unusual if you have just committed), you can create and switch to it using:</p><pre><div class="bg-black rounded-md"><div class="flex items-center relative text-gray-200 bg-gray-800 dark:bg-token-surface-primary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-md"><span>bash</span><button class="flex gap-1 items-center"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M12 4C10.8954 4 10 4.89543 10 6H14C14 4.89543 13.1046 4 12 4ZM8.53513 4C9.22675 2.8044 10.5194 2 12 2C13.4806 2 14.7733 2.8044 15.4649 4H17C18.6569 4 20 5.34315 20 7V19C20 20.6569 18.6569 22 17 22H7C5.34315 22 4 20.6569 4 19V7C4 5.34315 5.34315 4 7 4H8.53513ZM8 6H7C6.44772 6 6 6.44772 6 7V19C6 19.5523 6.44772 20 7 20H17C17.5523 20 18 19.5523 18 19V7C18 6.44772 17.5523 6 17 6H16C16 7.10457 15.1046 8 14 8H10C8.89543 8 8 7.10457 8 6Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></div><div class="p-4 overflow-y-auto"><code class="!whitespace-pre hljs language-bash">git checkout -b main
</code></div></div></pre><p>Then try the push command again.</p><p>Once you have successfully pushed your code to the GitHub repository, you can run <code>npm run deploy</code> to deploy your site to GitHub Pages. Remember to replace <code>main</code> with the actual name of your default branch if it's different.</p></div></div></div><div class="mt-1 flex justify-start gap-3 empty:hidden"><div data-message-id="be6529bc-4811-43f9-9be7-eed04ab7bdc8" class="min-h-[20px] text-message flex flex-col items-start gap-3 whitespace-pre-wrap break-words [.text-message+&amp;]:mt-5 overflow-x-auto"><div class="markdown prose w-full break-words dark:prose-invert dark"><p>If you have both a <code>master</code> and a <code>main</code> branch in your repository, and you've been working with and pushed to the <code>master</code> branch, you'll want to decide which branch should be your primary branch for the project.</p><p>GitHub has been using <code>main</code> as the default branch name for new repositories since October 2020. However, some older repositories or those created with certain settings might still use <code>master</code> as the default.</p><p>Here's what you can do:</p><h3>1. <strong>Set the Default Branch on GitHub</strong></h3><p>You can change the default branch in your GitHub repository settings:</p><ul><li>Go to your repository on GitHub.</li><li>Click on the "Settings" tab.</li><li>In the left sidebar, click on "Branches."</li><li>In the "Default branch" section, select the branch you want to use as the default from the dropdown menu.</li><li>Confirm the change if prompted.</li></ul><p>If you want to use <code>master</code> as your default, set it here. If you prefer to use <code>main</code>, set that as the default.</p><h3>2. <strong>Delete the Unused Branch</strong></h3><p>After setting the default branch, you can delete the unused one. <strong>Make sure that you do not delete the branch that contains your work.</strong></p><p>To delete the unused branch locally and on GitHub:</p><ul><li><p><strong>Locally</strong>: Switch to the branch you want to keep (<code>git checkout master</code>), then delete the other branch (<code>git branch -d main</code>). You might need to use <code>-D</code> instead of <code>-d</code> if the branch has not been fully merged.</p></li><li><p><strong>On GitHub</strong>: Go to your repository, click on "Branches" near the top of the repository page, find the branch you want to delete, and click the trash can icon to delete it.</p></li></ul><h3>3. <strong>Update Local Repository</strong></h3><p>If you've changed the default branch on GitHub to <code>main</code>, make sure your local repository is up to date:</p><ul><li><p>Fetch the latest changes from GitHub:</p><pre><div class="bg-black rounded-md"><div class="flex items-center relative text-gray-200 bg-gray-800 dark:bg-token-surface-primary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-md"><span>bash</span><button class="flex gap-1 items-center"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M12 4C10.8954 4 10 4.89543 10 6H14C14 4.89543 13.1046 4 12 4ZM8.53513 4C9.22675 2.8044 10.5194 2 12 2C13.4806 2 14.7733 2.8044 15.4649 4H17C18.6569 4 20 5.34315 20 7V19C20 20.6569 18.6569 22 17 22H7C5.34315 22 4 20.6569 4 19V7C4 5.34315 5.34315 4 7 4H8.53513ZM8 6H7C6.44772 6 6 6.44772 6 7V19C6 19.5523 6.44772 20 7 20H17C17.5523 20 18 19.5523 18 19V7C18 6.44772 17.5523 6 17 6H16C16 7.10457 15.1046 8 14 8H10C8.89543 8 8 7.10457 8 6Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></div><div class="p-4 overflow-y-auto"><code class="!whitespace-pre hljs language-bash">git fetch origin
</code></div></div></pre></li><li><p>Check out the <code>main</code> branch and set it to track the remote <code>main</code> branch:</p><pre><div class="bg-black rounded-md"><div class="flex items-center relative text-gray-200 bg-gray-800 dark:bg-token-surface-primary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-md"><span>bash</span><button class="flex gap-1 items-center"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M12 4C10.8954 4 10 4.89543 10 6H14C14 4.89543 13.1046 4 12 4ZM8.53513 4C9.22675 2.8044 10.5194 2 12 2C13.4806 2 14.7733 2.8044 15.4649 4H17C18.6569 4 20 5.34315 20 7V19C20 20.6569 18.6569 22 17 22H7C5.34315 22 4 20.6569 4 19V7C4 5.34315 5.34315 4 7 4H8.53513ZM8 6H7C6.44772 6 6 6.44772 6 7V19C6 19.5523 6.44772 20 7 20H17C17.5523 20 18 19.5523 18 19V7C18 6.44772 17.5523 6 17 6H16C16 7.10457 15.1046 8 14 8H10C8.89543 8 8 7.10457 8 6Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></div><div class="p-4 overflow-y-auto"><code class="!whitespace-pre hljs language-bash">git checkout -b main origin/main
</code></div></div></pre></li><li><p>Delete the old <code>master</code> branch locally if you don't need it:</p><pre><div class="bg-black rounded-md"><div class="flex items-center relative text-gray-200 bg-gray-800 dark:bg-token-surface-primary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-md"><span>bash</span><button class="flex gap-1 items-center"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M12 4C10.8954 4 10 4.89543 10 6H14C14 4.89543 13.1046 4 12 4ZM8.53513 4C9.22675 2.8044 10.5194 2 12 2C13.4806 2 14.7733 2.8044 15.4649 4H17C18.6569 4 20 5.34315 20 7V19C20 20.6569 18.6569 22 17 22H7C5.34315 22 4 20.6569 4 19V7C4 5.34315 5.34315 4 7 4H8.53513ZM8 6H7C6.44772 6 6 6.44772 6 7V19C6 19.5523 6.44772 20 7 20H17C17.5523 20 18 19.5523 18 19V7C18 6.44772 17.5523 6 17 6H16C16 7.10457 15.1046 8 14 8H10C8.89543 8 8 7.10457 8 6Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></div><div class="p-4 overflow-y-auto"><code class="!whitespace-pre hljs language-bash">git branch -d master
</code></div></div></pre><p>Or, if you want to keep it, just ensure it's up to date:</p><pre><div class="bg-black rounded-md"><div class="flex items-center relative text-gray-200 bg-gray-800 dark:bg-token-surface-primary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-md"><span>bash</span><button class="flex gap-1 items-center"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M12 4C10.8954 4 10 4.89543 10 6H14C14 4.89543 13.1046 4 12 4ZM8.53513 4C9.22675 2.8044 10.5194 2 12 2C13.4806 2 14.7733 2.8044 15.4649 4H17C18.6569 4 20 5.34315 20 7V19C20 20.6569 18.6569 22 17 22H7C5.34315 22 4 20.6569 4 19V7C4 5.34315 5.34315 4 7 4H8.53513ZM8 6H7C6.44772 6 6 6.44772 6 7V19C6 19.5523 6.44772 20 7 20H17C17.5523 20 18 19.5523 18 19V7C18 6.44772 17.5523 6 17 6H16C16 7.10457 15.1046 8 14 8H10C8.89543 8 8 7.10457 8 6Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></div><div class="p-4 overflow-y-auto"><code class="!whitespace-pre hljs language-bash">git checkout master
git pull origin master
</code></div></div></pre></li></ul><h3>4. <strong>Continue with Deployment</strong></h3><p>Now that you've organized your branches, you can continue with your deployment to GitHub Pages:</p><ul><li><p>If you set <code>main</code> as your default branch, update the <code>deploy</code> script in your <code>package.json</code> to push to <code>main</code>:</p><pre><div class="bg-black rounded-md"><div class="flex items-center relative text-gray-200 bg-gray-800 dark:bg-token-surface-primary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-md"><span>json</span><button class="flex gap-1 items-center"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M12 4C10.8954 4 10 4.89543 10 6H14C14 4.89543 13.1046 4 12 4ZM8.53513 4C9.22675 2.8044 10.5194 2 12 2C13.4806 2 14.7733 2.8044 15.4649 4H17C18.6569 4 20 5.34315 20 7V19C20 20.6569 18.6569 22 17 22H7C5.34315 22 4 20.6569 4 19V7C4 5.34315 5.34315 4 7 4H8.53513ZM8 6H7C6.44772 6 6 6.44772 6 7V19C6 19.5523 6.44772 20 7 20H17C17.5523 20 18 19.5523 18 19V7C18 6.44772 17.5523 6 17 6H16C16 7.10457 15.1046 8 14 8H10C8.89543 8 8 7.10457 8 6Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></div><div class="p-4 overflow-y-auto"><code class="!whitespace-pre hljs language-json"><span class="hljs-attr">"scripts"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-punctuation">{</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"deploy"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">"gh-pages -b main -d dist"</span>
<span class="hljs-punctuation">}</span>
</code></div></div></pre></li><li><p>Run the deploy command:</p><pre><div class="bg-black rounded-md"><div class="flex items-center relative text-gray-200 bg-gray-800 dark:bg-token-surface-primary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-md"><span>bash</span><button class="flex gap-1 items-center"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M12 4C10.8954 4 10 4.89543 10 6H14C14 4.89543 13.1046 4 12 4ZM8.53513 4C9.22675 2.8044 10.5194 2 12 2C13.4806 2 14.7733 2.8044 15.4649 4H17C18.6569 4 20 5.34315 20 7V19C20 20.6569 18.6569 22 17 22H7C5.34315 22 4 20.6569 4 19V7C4 5.34315 5.34315 4 7 4H8.53513ZM8 6H7C6.44772 6 6 6.44772 6 7V19C6 19.5523 6.44772 20 7 20H17C17.5523 20 18 19.5523 18 19V7C18 6.44772 17.5523 6 17 6H16C16 7.10457 15.1046 8 14 8H10C8.89543 8 8 7.10457 8 6Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></div><div class="p-4 overflow-y-auto"><code class="!whitespace-pre hljs language-bash">npm run deploy
</code></div></div></pre></li></ul><p>This command will now push the contents from the <code>dist</code> directory to the <code>main</code> branch of your GitHub repository (or <code>master</code> if you've decided to keep using the <code>master</code> branch).</p><p>Remember to update any branch references in your CI/CD pipelines, documentation, and local Git configurations to reflect the branch you've decided to use as your default.</p></div></div></div><div class="mt-1 flex justify-start gap-3 empty:hidden"><div class="text-gray-400 flex self-end lg:self-center justify-center This is indicated by the GitHub Pages section of your repository settings showing that your site is being built from the <code>main</code> branch.</p><p>When you set up GitHub Pages, you can choose which branch and folder you want to serve your site from. In your case, it's set to deploy from the <code>main</code> branch and the root directory (<code>/</code>). If you have pushed your built files to the <code>main</code> branch, then GitHub Pages will serve those files as your website.</p><p>If you are following the common practice where the <code>main</code> branch contains your source code and a separate <code>gh-pages</code> branch contains the built static files for GitHub Pages, you will need to change the source setting to the <code>gh-pages</code> branch. However, if you are deploying directly from the <code>main</code> branch and including your build output in the same branch, then the current setting is correct.</p><p>The branch marked as default in your repository settings under the "Branches" section is the one that GitHub considers the primary branch. It looks like <code>main</code> is indeed your default branch. If you need to change the default branch, you can do so in the "Branches" settings by clicking on the branches tab, finding the "Default branch" section, and selecting the branch you want to set as [.text-message+&amp;]:mt-5 overflow-x-auto"><div class="markdown prose w-full break-words dark:prose-invert dark"><p>If you have pushed new changes to the <code>master</code> branch and want to replace the contents of the <code>main</code> branch with those changes, you can merge <code>master</code> into <code>main</code> or directly push the <code>master</code> branch's content to <code>main</code>. Here's how you can do it:</p><h3>Option 1: Merge <code>master</code> into <code>main</code></h3><ol><li><p><strong>Switch to the <code>main</code> branch:</strong></p><pre><div class="bg-black rounded-md"><div class="flex items-center relative text-gray-200 bg-gray-800 dark:bg-token-surface-primary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-md"><span>bash</span><button class="flex gap-1 items-center"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M12 4C10.8954 4 10 4.89543 10 6H14C14 4.89543 13.1046 4 12 4ZM8.53513 4C9.22675 2.8044 10.5194 2 12 2C13.4806 2 14.7733 2.8044 15.4649 4H17C18.6569 4 20 5.34315 20 7V19C20 20.6569 18.6569 22 17 22H7C5.34315 22 4 20.6569 4 19V7C4 5.34315 5.34315 4 7 4H8.53513ZM8 6H7C6.44772 6 6 6.44772 6 7V19C6 19.5523 6.44772 20 7 20H17C17.5523 20 18 19.5523 18 19V7C18 6.44772 17.5523 6 17 6H16C16 7.10457 15.1046 8 14 8H10C8.89543 8 8 7.10457 8 6Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></div><div class="p-4 overflow-y-auto"><code class="!whitespace-pre hljs language-bash">git checkout main
</code></div></div></pre></li><li><p><strong>Merge <code>master</code> into <code>main</code>:</strong></p><pre><div class="bg-black rounded-md"><div class="flex items-center relative text-gray-200 bg-gray-800 dark:bg-token-surface-primary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-md"><span>bash</span><button class="flex gap-1 items-center"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M12 4C10.8954 4 10 4.89543 10 6H14C14 4.89543 13.1046 4 12 4ZM8.53513 4C9.22675 2.8044 10.5194 2 12 2C13.4806 2 14.7733 2.8044 15.4649 4H17C18.6569 4 20 5.34315 20 7V19C20 20.6569 18.6569 22 17 22H7C5.34315 22 4 20.6569 4 19V7C4 5.34315 5.34315 4 7 4H8.53513ZM8 6H7C6.44772 6 6 6.44772 6 7V19C6 19.5523 6.44772 20 7 20H17C17.5523 20 18 19.5523 18 19V7C18 6.44772 17.5523 6 17 6H16C16 7.10457 15.1046 8 14 8H10C8.89543 8 8 7.10457 8 6Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></div><div class="p-4 overflow-y-auto"><code class="!whitespace-pre hljs language-bash">git merge master
</code></div></div></pre></li><li><p><strong>Resolve any merge conflicts if they exist.</strong></p></li><li><p><strong>Push the updated <code>main</code> branch to GitHub:</strong></p><pre><div class="bg-black rounded-md"><div class="flex items-center relative text-gray-200 bg-gray-800 dark:bg-token-surface-primary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-md"><span>bash</span><button class="flex gap-1 items-center"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M12 4C10.8954 4 10 4.89543 10 6H14C14 4.89543 13.1046 4 12 4ZM8.53513 4C9.22675 2.8044 10.5194 2 12 2C13.4806 2 14.7733 2.8044 15.4649 4H17C18.6569 4 20 5.34315 20 7V19C20 20.6569 18.6569 22 17 22H7C5.34315 22 4 20.6569 4 19V7C4 5.34315 5.34315 4 7 4H8.53513ZM8 6H7C6.44772 6 6 6.44772 6 7V19C6 19.5523 6.44772 20 7 20H17C17.5523 20 18 19.5523 18 19V7C18 6.44772 17.5523 6 17 6H16C16 7.10457 15.1046 8 14 8H10C8.89543 8 8 7.10457 8 6Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></div><div class="p-4 overflow-y-auto"><code class="!whitespace-pre hljs language-bash">git push origin main
</code></div></div></pre></li></ol><h3>Option 2: Force Push <code>master</code> to <code>main</code></h3><p>If you want to completely overwrite <code>main</code> with the contents of <code>master</code>, you can do a force push. However, be careful with this method because it rewrites history and can cause issues for anyone else who is working on the same repository.</p><ol><li><p><strong>Make sure your <code>master</code> branch is up-to-date:</strong></p><pre><div class="bg-black rounded-md"><div class="flex items-center relative text-gray-200 bg-gray-800 dark:bg-token-surface-primary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-md"><span>bash</span><button class="flex gap-1 items-center"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M12 4C10.8954 4 10 4.89543 10 6H14C14 4.89543 13.1046 4 12 4ZM8.53513 4C9.22675 2.8044 10.5194 2 12 2C13.4806 2 14.7733 2.8044 15.4649 4H17C18.6569 4 20 5.34315 20 7V19C20 20.6569 18.6569 22 17 22H7C5.34315 22 4 20.6569 4 19V7C4 5.34315 5.34315 4 7 4H8.53513ZM8 6H7C6.44772 6 6 6.44772 6 7V19C6 19.5523 6.44772 20 7 20H17C17.5523 20 18 19.5523 18 19V7C18 6.44772 17.5523 6 17 6H16C16 7.10457 15.1046 8 14 8H10C8.89543 8 8 7.10457 8 6Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></div><div class="p-4 overflow-y-auto"><code class="!whitespace-pre hljs language-bash">git checkout master
git pull origin master
</code></div></div></pre></li><li><p><strong>Force push <code>master</code> to <code>main</code>:</strong></p><pre><div class="bg-black rounded-md"><div class="flex items-center relative text-gray-200 bg-gray-800 dark:bg-token-surface-primary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-md"><span>bash</span><button class="flex gap-1 items-center"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-sm"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M12 4C10.8954 4 10 4.89543 10 6H14C14 4.89543 13.1046 4 12 4ZM8.53513 4C9.22675 2.8044 10.5194 2 12 2C13.4806 2 14.7733 2.8044 15.4649 4H17C18.6569 4 20 5.34315 20 7V19C20 20.6569 18.6569 22 17 22H7C5.34315 22 4 20.6569 4 19V7C4 5.34315 5.34315 4 7 4H8.53513ZM8 6H7C6.44772 6 6 6.44772 6 7V19C6 19.5523 6.44772 20 7 20H17C17.5523 20 18 19.5523 18 19V7C18 6.44772 17.5523 6 17 6H16C16 7.10457 15.1046 8 14 8H10C8.89543 8 8 7.10457 8 6Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy code</button></div><div class="p-4 overflow-y-auto"><code class="!whitespace-pre hljs language-bash">git push origin master:main --force
</code></div></div></pre></li></ol><h3>Important Considerations</h3><ul><li><p><strong>Backup</strong>: Before force pushing, it's a good idea to make a backup of your <code>main</code> branch in case you need to revert.</p></li><li><p><strong>Collaborators</strong>: If others are working on the repository, inform them of the change as it could disrupt their workflows.</p></li><li><p><strong>Open Pull Requests</strong>: If there are open pull requests targeting the <code>main</code> branch, these might need to be adjusted after the force push.</p></li><li><p><strong>History</strong>: Be aware that force pushing will overwrite the commit history on <code>main</code> with that of <code>master</code>. If there are important differences in the histories of the two branches that you want to preserve, a merge is preferable.</p></li></ul><p>Once you've aligned <code>main</code> with the contents of <code>master</code>, continue to use <code>main</code> for your work, and make sure to push future changes to <code>main</code>. If <code>master</code> is no longer needed, you can consider deleting it to avoid confusion.</p></div></div></div><div class="mt-1 flex justify-start gap-3 empty:hidden"><div class="text-gray-400 flex
